message:
Hi Stephen, thanks for your great post.  
I have a question, you wrote that "within a request context, only one thread can actually execute code at a time". Does that mean in legacy ASP.NET app, using Task.WhenAll is useless?  
I used to think that Task Scheduler will run the tasks we put to the WhenAll method using thread from thread pools. Is there anyway to do so given that we don't need the request context in those worker tasks?

Thanks
